txt.en: Talk to Angelica
Check the sitting room for Boffins
Check the kitchen for Boffins
Check the storage room for Boffins
'Wait...'
'Her whole family?'
'Dino! We know someone JUST LIKE THAT!'
Angelica is in her new home: 8 Honeymead Lane, Nobottle.
'Our sister Angelica!'
'Welcome to Yondershire, Angelica!'
Angelica thinks you should check that her siblings are all still here, and haven't gone missing again.
Angelica is waiting for your report in her new home.
'What a pleasant party this was! Quite enjoyable for everyone, I would say.\n\n'Might I speak with you, [placeholder]? Outside, I think.'

'Thank you very much for coming to Yondershire to welcome me to my new home, [placeholder]. It means a lot to me that you would take the time, and also that you would help gather all my siblings together again after they scattered to the winds!'

A worried expression suddenly crosses Angelica's face.

'They are still all here, right? Maybe you'd better check.'
The Boffin children have all returned to Nobottle and now Angelica's house-warming party can happen without further delay.
Bingo stands in the hallway of Angelica's new burrow, smiling cheerfully.

Just as you finish telling Angelica (with some surprise) that her siblings are all still here and have not gone a-wandering, there is a knocking on the door.\n\n'I thought you said they were all here?' the hobbit-girl asks you.
A visitor has come to 8 Honeymead Lane during Angelica's house-warming party.
Marigold and Griffo are in the dining room

'This must be Magetha Grubb!' Bingo offers cheerfully.\n\n'Shortly after returning from Tighfield, I bumped into Angelica's new neighbour. She had nothing but the kindest things to say about her visit with you and Camellia, [placeholder], and I thought it would be a nice gesture to invite her to Angelica's house-warming party, along with her whole family.'
Berilac has found himself a napping spot
Angelica is beside herself with excitement.

'Did you and my siblings arrange for this, [placeholder]? You must have! Imagine: I can spend all day taking care of Magetha's menagerie... I am so pleased I moved here!\n\n'This is the very finest house-warming present I could have imagined! Thank you all so much!'
Prisca is pleased that everything turned out well.

'You should have told me what you and Bingo were planning, [placeholder]! I am sorry I was so suspicious before... clearly all of my children had their own errands to attend to in order to set up this surprise for Angelica.

'At any rate, all is well now. Of all my children, only Angelica would forgive so many animals loose in her new home! Keep that in mind when the next one moves out, [placeholder]: Fosco will not be so happy with such a gift. Maybe a decoration will suit him better: a painting of a boat, perhaps.

'Thank you for all you have done! This was a lovely day after all!'
'Welcome to Yondershire!'
Co-conspirators Camellia and Dinodas are here, of course
Fosco and Esmeralda are in the sitting room
'No matter. I'll get it!'
'There are so many creatures in my house...'
'I love it!'
'Not at all! I would like nothing better!'
'Look at all the dear ones!'
'Oh my!'
'Thank you for inviting me and my lovelies to your party!'
'I have to leave my small ones at home during the day, and I miss them so.'
'I am so glad, neighbour!'
'I wanted to thank you for the very thoughtful gift.'
'It had never occurred to me that there was such a tradition.'
'I beg your pardon?'
'It does, now more than ever.'
'It's true, and I miss them so!'
'It would not be too great a bother, would it?'
Talk to Angelica
Talk to Bingo
Survive the house-warming party without embarrassment
Talk to Angelica
'I am sorry to interrupt, but I have had a thought.'
Talk to Prisca
'I understand that Magetha's work brings her all over Yondershire during the day.'
'And that means that all of your creatures must get quite lonely while you are away.'
'Well, what do you think, Dinodas?'
'Do you know anyone who loves to take care of animals?'
'Hooray!'
'Then it's settled.'
'Not really.'
'Welcome to Yondershire!'
'Welcome to Yondershire, Angelica!'
Instance: A Very Boffin House-warming
